Detailed Description

This class paves the way for mutating the struture of neural networks.

Operations include counting inputs and outputs of a given neuron, checking which neurons or connections could be deleted, and where neurons and connections could be added.

Member Function Documentation

void FFManip::connectNew (  Array< int > &    c,
Array< double > &    w,
unsigned    pos,
double    low,
double    high
)  [protected]
 

Add a connection from a given neuron to a randomly selected neuron.

The weight for the newly added connection is generated randomly within a given interval

Parameters:
c:  connection matrix
w:  weight matrix
pos:  the neuron from which a new connection should be added
low:  lower bound of the interval for generating a random weight
high:  upper bound of the interval for generating a random weight

Array<unsigned> FFManip::dispensableFFConnection (  Array< int > &    c,
const unsigned    nIn,
const unsigned    nHid
)  [protected]
 

Check which connections can be deleted.

A connection can be removed if after deletion, all neurons have at least one input and one output

Parameters:
c:  connection matrix
nIn:  number of input nodes
nHid:  number of hidden nodes

)  [protected]
 

initialize the connections randomly of a block of layered feedforward neural network

Parameters:
nIn:  number of input nodes
nHid:  number of hidden nodes
nOut:  number of output nodes
prob1:  probability for a connection between input and hidden nodes
prob2:  probability for a connection between hidden and output nodes
prob3:  probability for a connection between bias nodes and other nodes
